status_message:
Today's judgement has reaffirmed that the unelected, unrepresentative House of Lords will be permitted a vote yet the devolved regions will not.

Last week Theresa May set out her vision for a Tory hard Brexit which, if left unchallenged, will mean a hard border in Ireland. 

Everyone on this island has a responsibility to ensure that this does not happen. 

We will submit our own amendments and support any other amendments which protect our interests. 
We will vote against any Bill which triggers Article 50. 
We urge all pro-Remain MPs to join us in this action.
link_name: SDLP Leader responds to Supreme Court ruling | 2017 | News

status_message:
While the Executive is still at a standing start, SDLP Leader Colum Eastwood MLA has been leading the campaign to defend the will of the 56% of people here who voted to remain in the EU.

After making the case for EU special status at a summit of leaders and Heads of State in Prague, today he was at the Supreme Court in London for the beginning of our legal proceedings demanding the Assembly be given a vote on the triggering of Article 50.

We did not consent to being dragged out of Europe. We voted to remain an open, diverse and prosperous people. The SDLP will defend that position.

Join us www.sdlp.ie/about/get-involved
link_name: Colum Eastwood MLA

status_message:
SDLP Leader Colum Eastwood MLA has been in Prague over the last number of days at a summit of European Leaders and Heads of State within the Party of European Socialists.

He's been making the case for EU Special Status for Northern Ireland in the case of a Brexit. That means free movement of people across this island, tariff free, uninhibited access to the single market,  as well as continued access to infrastructure and other funding streams.

We're continuing to defend the will of the 56% of people who voted to remain. Join us! www.sdlp.ie/about/get-involved

status_message:
It's World AIDS Day today. And to help tackle the stigma of this terrible disease and highlight the need for early testing, Mark Durkan MP has taken his own HIV test at Westminster.

Because HIV is a condition that can affect anyone who's sexually active, regardless of their orientation. 

1 in 5 people living with HIV are unaware that they've contracted the virus. If you think you're at risk, get tested without delay.

Nurses in England, Wales and Scotland can expect to earn more than our nurses here. Is that fair? We don't think so.

We all know how hard our health service staff work to look after our friends and family in difficult times. Isn't it about time we started looking after them?
